com.nizite.boi_ai.problems

Class Problem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nizite.boi_ai.problems.Problem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sudoku

    public abstract class Problem
extends java.lang.Object
    Base implementation to define an AI problem. Should leave search space and boundaries really clear, as well as all info necessary for a Representation and Algorithm to resolve. It does not resolve anything by itself.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    d-rivera-c

    • Field Detail

      • _constraints

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> _constraints
        Hardcoded constraints. Since soft/hard constraints can change depending on what is being analyzed, all constraints are put on the same list, and on program run can be selected. Only a list of human readable string, real work of calculation will be done by Representation.calculateFitness(com.nizite.boi_ai.representations.Atom)

      • _soft

        protected int[] _soft
        Soft constraints to be enforced. Set up in Problem#config(String, String, String), picked by the user. Follows the indexes set in {@link Problem#_soft}

      • _hard

        protected int[] _hard
        Hard constraints to be enforced. Set up in Problem#config(String, String, String), picked by the user. Follows the indexes set in _hard

      • _objectiveFunction

        protected java.lang.String _objectiveFunction
        Text-only explanation of what the objective function should do. The actual implementation is tied to the representation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Problem

        public Problem()

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public abstract void setup(java.lang.String setup)
                    throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                           java.lang.Exception
        Receives a String read from a config file and parses it in its important parts (unique to each problem). Saves in the unique variables all info needed. Sets problem specific variables. Should be used to parse a String defining the whole problem and divide it into different variables.
        Parameters:
        setup -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        java.lang.NumberFormatException

      • getInfo

        public abstract java.lang.Object[] getInfo()
        The only way to get the problem's detail info after parsing and organizing the setup file. It's up to Representation to organize this into an Atom to be handled within its class.
        Returns:
        Object[] with all the parsed info of the problem.

      • config

        public void config(java.lang.String soft,
                   java.lang.String hard)
            throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                   java.lang.InstantiationException,
                   java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Sets how many soft & hard constraints to be aware of. While it doesn't do anything with it, all the config and setup is stored in the Problem to be accessible by Representations and Algorithms if needed.
        Parameters:
        soft -
        hard -
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
